comments.snippet:
Hi 

I think this is a limitation of Putty (and the SSH protocol), which is not directly in control of the mRemoteNG project. Eg. I know for sure that putty terminates the sessions when the IP stack changes, so I guess the sleep in Windows 11 also disables the network for power savings and therefore causes the putty sessions to fail.
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet: This is normal and expected, this has also todo with session security and in the end every secure remote protocoll should do this to avoid too long session lifetimes. You may use a tool like screen to "keepalive" sessions when connecting back. see https://linux.die.net/man/1/screen
comments.author: thetuxinator

comments.snippet: Frankly speaking its expected behaviour as mentioned above due security, but may have a quick look a bit later today if its possible to add option keep alive or smth like such, logically it may be option reconnect on wakeup as well.
comments.author: Kvarkas

comments.snippet: @Kvarkas you can't do anything on the client side actually, because the server has (as of good practice security) some session timeouts and also tcp has them, so it's not woth to spent time on. if the server kills your tcp or ssh session while you are "disconnected/ on standby" -> game over ;-)
comments.author: thetuxinator

comments.snippet: Ah and i almost forgot, you can't send keepalive when you are offline/in sleep
